creator: cekhchung1@hotmail.com
text:
I have recompiled the htpasswd.exe for fixing the "-n and -c" conflict, but 
runtime error occurs. Do you have any idea on this issue?

Initial procedure:
--------------------
1. Update the htpasswd.exe for fixing "-n and -c " conflict problem.

Procedure:
--------------------
1. Open a commend prompt and go to the "Apache\bin" directory
2. Enter the following command: 
"htpasswd -c passwd tony"
3. Enter password in the prompt.
4. Runtime error occurs.

Error Message:
---------------------------
---------------------------
htpasswd.exe - Application Error
---------------------------
The instruction at "0x0040363d" referenced memory at "0x00000004". The memory 
could not be "read".


Click on OK to terminate the program
Click on CANCEL to debug the program
---------------------------
OK   Cancel   
---------------------------
Confirmed.  Working on a fix shortly.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
You were correct, it was broke, and is fixed in CVS.  The fix will be distributed
  with Apache 2.0.40.  The bug was split in two, we closed an unopened file
  (the segv you observed) and we failed to copy the temp file (a bug in apr.)

  See http://httpd.apache.org/dev/ for information on access to snapshots of the
  tree later today, or how to get the current sources with the cvs utility
  from anoncvs.
